Pretty good job so for

Simple to pickup gameplay, takes practice to master, with replay value that goes through the roof. Every character has it's own learning curve and grind. DLCs are "worth it".  Developers consistently rework mechanics to swing the balance of the scales between survivor and killer through patches. This changes the status quo of strategies, making gamers on both sides learn and adapt to new strategies. Heart pounding, gut wrenching, pants wetting moments, shared with friends, shared with strangers, or endured as a lonesome.
巴适

你可以说黎明杀机有这样那样的问题，但不可否认，目前非对称竞技竞技游戏里，杀机是做的最好，也是PC端人气最高的一个。

加分项：
+ 相对平衡的游戏环境
+ 丰富的角色和技能池
+ 稳定高质量的DLC更新
+ Steam前20的在线人数保证了不会玩着玩着就凉
+ 大量的影视剧互动角色，增加了代入感
+ 新地图-死狗酒馆，以游戏内前所未有的风格和精细度，展现了制作组的上进心

扣分项：
- 频繁的小bug，包括但不限于卡加载，组队好友卡出房间等等
- 服务器不够完善
- 匹配系统近期不合理，红段（高段）人类长期匹配中低段屠夫，影响双方游戏体验
- 没有排位奖励，排位一段便是尽头，建议制作组学习炉石的排位系统，在一段之上增加传说段位并参与全球排名

非対称とはいえあまりにもゲームバランスが悪い。キラーのランク上昇が困難を極めている。

そういう意味ではお勧めできない。ゲーム自体は楽しいから私はプレイするんだけど。
The fucking sound has been bugged for months but i guess they dont plan on fixing it

游戏是个好游戏，也挺好玩的，讲讲现在的情况好了，大佬看到也别喷，这游戏本身是个非对称性游戏，但是我却看不懂有时候是屠夫强，有时候是人强，就现版本来说，人类还是强一点的，讲讲我玩这游戏的感觉吧，一开始我是只玩屠夫的，两天打到了9段，大概从15段往上，就开始匹配到红紫段的人，一开始我还挺有激情的，咱们比划比划呗，比划比划还能杀两个，运气好杀四个，然后到12段，每局最少三个紫段以上的时候，我比划不动了，特别是碰上车队，别跟我说你咋知道是车队，最少两个手电筒，人手一个打击，砍倒一个人瞬间出现两个在周围，就等你背，有打击被打击下来，没打击直接手电筒射哈dog眼，两个都被你躲过了，上钩基本秒救，救完我是真不知道该追谁，追原来上钩的要等打击，还有周围他的队友，追别的又是一轮重复，而且就先版本，碰上会玩的人，屠夫找人只要失误几次，电机都是两三台连着亮，还有守尸的问题，原则上确实是不守尸，正常情况我也不守尸，但是碰上速修队，等我挂上一个人四台机已经亮了，我能咋办？守尸，砍死消消气，不守，四跑，别说带一刀杀，电机修那么快，图腾拆的也是一个比一个快，现版本玩屠夫就像古时候陪公子念书的书童，我玩屠夫是来杀人的，不是来给各位当陪玩的，溜我宁的本事，我认了，碰上车队，炸鱼，红紫段的，我是真打不动了，打不动咋办，玩人呗，玩人我也菜，讲句实在的我就会修机，就凭修机，我玩人也上了10段，现在我玩人时间可能已经超过屠夫了，所以也别骂我是单边玩家，人类一般情况下，除非特别不会玩，一局里面，只要不是葫芦娃救爷爷，连续上树，赢的机会还是比较大的，我对游戏没有什么怨念，唯一想吐槽的就是匹配机制，跨两三段匹，偶尔打一打还能玩，日常打高段是真打不动，最后我也想说，人人都想要游戏环境好，还不是从个人做起？想屠夫不守尸，就别没事就嘲讽，想人类不当门皇，就别守尸，但是说实话，就我在网上看到的各种言论来说，玩人的是真事儿逼，什么规矩都是人类定的，动不动就什么树下孝子，屠夫five啥的，我想说各人有各人的玩法，人家爱咋玩咋玩，官方都没说怎么样，轮不到你们在这bb，当然，人皇们看到这句话又要说，屠夫守尸不就是five？还不是菜，你守你的，我骂我的，得嘞，宁开心就好，就像一说人类速修人类就说速修又没分，屠夫守尸不一样没分？这是个无止境的口水战而已，希望制作组能搞出一个比较好的解决办法吧！

Bueno, la verdad hace mucho tiempo que vengo jugando a este juego (valga la redundancia) y me pareció el momento oportuno para hacerle una buena review:
 [b]Momento de disfrute[/b]: Generalmente se da entre los rangos 15/20, no tenes idea de que hacen los perk (o capas si) y son todos mas o menos de tu nivel [spoiler]igual te vas a engranar (enojar), así que no te preocupes[/spoiler], por lo cual vas a poder jugar un poco con el asesino y disfrutar del juego.
 [b]Servidores dedicados[/b]: Algo que le hizo muy bien al juego, buenos servidores, buen ping, "buenas partidas" [spoiler]lo de buenas partidas esta entre comillas por ser algo subjetivo, ya que para mi, mis ultimas experiencias no están siendo muy gratificantes[/spoiler].
[b]Gameplay[/b]: Aquí viene lo bueno jóvenes!!! (busquen el meme de los simpson). Una real y completa bazofia, si jugás solo, te vas encontrar con gente random que generalmente no saben que hacer o hacen todo mal y un asesino que cuando se las ve feas (va perdiendo como Brasil frente a Alemania) recurre a la vieja confiable (campear y tunelear). Ahora si vas de asesino, es otra la historia, si no conoces las mecánicas, te vas a comer un baile que te van a hacer revolear el teclado y el mouse como una boleadora (buscar video para mejor idea). Bueno para no hacerla tan larga el resumen.
[b]Resumen: Haganse el favor de no comprar este juego, a menos que le guste la toxixidad de la gente y comerse un garron (pasar un mal rato).[/b]

As much as I love this game, I can't recommend it to anyone.

The DLC chapters cost over $100, and that's *before* skins. Normally I'd shrug this off, but the game itself costs $20, and outfits that aren't just simple recolors cost upwards of $10 each.

I love this game, but I can't support it when it's this overpriced. If they don't have a way to be able to afford the deals for licensed killers like Freddy, Leatherface, and the Demogorgon without overpricing these, then they shouldn't have gotten these and should've made unique killers.

9/10 without the microtransactions. I hope they can somehow turn around and fix this.

Dead by Daylight

At Dead by Daylight's launch, it was a great game, with a great concept. A 4 player coop game with strangers, trying to survive and escape an enclosed area, guarded by a killer with a unique ability. It was an exciting experience, and opened up a new concept of gaming that many other companies have tried and, for the most part, failed to replicate it's success. Behaviour Studios, the developers behind Dead by Daylight, have deserved the credit and title of a company that has successfully pioneered a new genre of gaming, and they've done it with excitement, care and love for their game.

As this game has gone on, patches have been introduced. And when new perks, new killers, new maps, and new ideas in general have been implemented through content, the game has become far more complex. Depending on the way you look at it, it is a double edged sword. More content is never a bad thing, and is always an exciting aspect to explore as a passionate fan. Discovering it's ins and outs, how it compares to previous gameplay, and purely, just the excitement that a game one loves has been given attention and care. On the other end of the sword, the more content, the more attention it draws. The player base grows, and becomes a bit harder to contain. People mention the amount of toxicity in this game, not because people are mean via what they say, but also how they play (whether they are the killer or survivor). The degree of what's fair for 4 people equating to one person is hard to judge, especially as the degree of complexity rises from content patch to content patch. Not to mention excitement-breaking bugs, long queue times, graphical errors, crashes, etc.

Now we're at a time in development where there have been plenty of great, love-filled content that the developers are very proud of, as they should be. They have implemented great and unique ideas have fans at the edge of their chair in excitement and pure joy, knowing that the game is still fresh and that there is something to look forward to. However it's player base has also grown to a substantial amount, for better but also for worse. Balancing a game with such a degree of complexity while maintaining consumer happiness seems improbable, as problems always seem to arise from seed, and grow into something that is harder to handle the longer the problem persists. Whether it is bugs, balance, back-end matchmaking, players ruining the experience for other players, and the list goes on, it's gotten to the point where the game feels so far from polished that it sits as one of the most toxic games conceived by the gaming community. There has been improvement, but as previously mentioned, the more that's fixed, the more becomes broken.

All in all I feel sorry for the developers. A game that they love and give a lot of attention to has given them a lot of fame, a lot of wealth, and a lot of meaning. But one has to ask at what cost? The pure joy and thrill of this genre has evaporated and has turned into a flame that where it can be extinguished in one place, it can spread in another. And at this point in development, it is too large to contain. They're vision of simplicity in this genre has grown into a competitive experience, where there will always be something to complain about from anyone's point of view. And yes, if you're reading at this point and wondering, "Why don't they do anything about it?!" The answer is: They are! But it's that our actions have consequences, and improving one aspect of the game can create several other issues in another aspect. They're vision of this game has been shaped by the community over the years, and as we all know, the community does NOT have a single voice. A great example of developers that have it right is Battle State Games, the developers behind the hardcore shooter, Escape From Tarkov. It's a hardcore intense first person shooter with an incredible amount of detail. The developers listen, and take in feedback, but they don't let it affect their final product of what they vision Escape From Tarkov is, and will become. Dead By Daylight unfortunately has taken the wrong turn at the fork in the road, and it's too far to come back.

If you haven't explored this genre of games, go ahead and explore it! As previously mentioned, Dead by Daylight really pioneered the asymmetrical horror genre, and got it right. But please for your own sake, play it for the sake of thrill and excitement. If you start to think about it competitively, meta this, not useful that, tier list this, useless that, you really need to start thinking about whether this game is good for your mental well-being. As for new players? Go ahead and give it a shot, but I wouldn't be surprised if you get frustrated very quickly. And please understand, it's not because you lack the experience, it is because of so, SO much more.

I stopped playing this game a while ago, even though it's one of my most played games. And I have to admit my gaming experiences have dramatically become more positive. My interactions with other gamers on the internet have gotten a lot better. And although I, much like everyone, have my own individual and personal problems to deal with, my time away from Dead by Daylight has definitely attributed to my mental strength. That's not to say you're not allowed to enjoy this game, however just watch yourself, that you don't go too deep into the rabbit's hole.
Pretty fun game. I have no complaints at all.

S mými 300+ hodinami si myslím, že mám na této hře už něco nahráno a taky si myslím, že o ní už něco vím. Podle mě, je DBD jedna z nejlepších her, co jsem kdy hrál (čistě můj názor, mám na tyto hry prostě vkus). Jednoduchá na pochopení, složitější na naučení. DLC můžete kupovat jak za reálné peníze, tak i za herní měnu, kterou získáte za levelování. Hra je velice dobře optimalizovaná a je celkem i balancovaná, třebaže někteří killeři jsou trošku slabší než ostatní a proto se moc nehrajou, ale na nižších a středních rancích toto moc nejde poznat. Navíc, když ji hrajete s přáteli, zábava je o to větší. Věřím, že DBD tu s námi bude ještě dlouho. Hodnotím 9/10.

Killer keeps feeling worse and survivor lobbies take forever. Fun with friends though.

This game also has a worse matchmaking system that Halo Infinite. If you are new it will take you minimum of 400 hours to understand all the perks and basic gameplay loops. And until then you will get matched with people who have 3k plus hours because the only casual audience is survive with friends. 

If you are up for that then buy it on sale or g2a. These devs do not deserve your money.
